channel.title: The Quiz, Made in JAVA!
channel.description:
//=======================THE QUIZ==============\\
Ok, HAI people and welcome to my first program coded in Java core language, it's nothing huge, hense "core" and theres no client or w.e it's all through your COMMAND PROMPT
Simply download the files, Extract, click "play" you can check it yourself to make sure theres no bug idc.
Answer the 5 questions, then post your results here, and answer the polls
As stated in the ReadMe, the results arn't accurate obviously, so please refrain from going ballistic at your results
This was coded IN JAVA, written by me and the help of Java Core tutorials (i already knew most of the stuff, just there was some added "suggested" things i put in i didn't know about) And don't be harsh on what i made, it was just something for fun, for everyone to try :)
Downloads:
Mirror One: http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?2iuujghmwjj http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?2iuujghmwjj http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?2iuujghmwjj http://www.mediafire.com/download.php?2iuujghmwjj
Mirror Two: http://uppit.com/v/QMLELRBA http://uppit.com/v/QMLELRBA http://uppit.com/v/QMLELRBA http://uppit.com/v/QMLELRBA
ENJO ANDHAVE FUN! AND POST YOUR DAMN RESULTS!!@!@!
ALSO POST ANY ERRORS YOU GET
IF I SEE ALOT OF POLL RESULTS (20 is good i guess) ILL POST THE OPEN SOURCE FOR ANYONE WHO WANTS IT! :)
[DISCUSS] Discuss your result and what you think of the program/questions/result (i couldn't think of good questions so yes they r lame :))

item.description:
@_A_mpd wrote:

[quote=“Jc22493, post:66, topic:300929”][quote author=Cur link=topic=397212.msg2952723#msg2952723 date=1252633193]

I don’t like your conventions.

if (everyoneSTFU == true) { flaming = false; }
cough I know someone will say they don’t like mine. cough

I am someone.

if (everyoneSTFU == true) 
<tab> flaming = false;

Brackets are for choobs.

They’re actually called curly braces, ‘choob’.

You can call them either one…

Lolye, I was jk, if you sensed that. >_<’

lol what a retard, they’re not curly braces, they’re called brackers u fucking mongoloid
[/quote]
I’m quite sure they aren’t called ‘brackers’. Just so you know, they can be called either brackets or curly braces, although brackets is used more often.[/quote]

no u fucking retard wtf u talkin about? fucking stupid jackie chan fucker!!11111111

item.title: The Quiz, Made in JAVA!
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

[code]public class ShutUp {

public static boolean LOOP = true;
public static long TIMER;

public static void main(String[] args) {
	while (LOOP) {
		if (System.currentTimeMillis() - TIMER >= 1500) {
			TIMER = System.currentTimeMillis();
			System.out.println("Shut up with the retarded code pastes.");
		}
	}
}

}[/code]

Have fun running that.

Read full topic

item.title: The Quiz, Made in JAVA!
item.dc:creator: @the1337legend the1337legend
item.description:
@the1337legend wrote:

[quote=“SonGoku, post:52, topic:300929”]#1: No need to have multiple java/class files for each question. Why not have a singular class that can be used for any question?

Example:

public class Question {

	public Question(String question, String answer) {
		this.question = question;
		this.answer = answer;
	}

	public String getQuestion() {
		return question;
	}

	public String getAnswer() {
		return answer;
	}

	private String question;
	private String answer;
}

#2: Reading over the convention docs; again wouldn’t hurt. Although it will not improve the code for the machine, it will improve it to the human eye.

To the idiots ITT:

It doesn’t matter what you call it. Coding, Programming, it’s all the same thing. There’s also no need to call eachother names. We’re suppose to help one another advance themselves, not put them down.[/quote]

thanks

Read full topic

item.title: The Quiz, Made in JAVA!
item.dc:creator: @SonGoku SonGoku
item.description:
@SonGoku wrote:

#1: No need to have multiple java/class files for each question. Why not have a singular class that can be used for any question?

Example:

public class Question {

	public Question(String question, String answer) {
		this.question = question;
		this.answer = answer;
	}

	public String getQuestion() {
		return question;
	}

	public String getAnswer() {
		return answer;
	}

	private String question;
	private String answer;
}

#2: Reading over the convention docs; again wouldn’t hurt. Although it will not improve the code for the machine, it will improve it to the human eye.

To the idiots ITT:

It doesn’t matter what you call it. Coding, Programming, it’s all the same thing. There’s also no need to call eachother names. We’re suppose to help one another advance themselves, not put them down.

Read full topic
